$ident_quote_suffix null $username $password $options array() $pdo $signal __construct $dsn array $username $password $options array $signal SignalManager getDsnString connect query $spec $data array() array fetchAll Fetches all rows from the database using sequential keys. string array array $spec $data array() fetchAssoc Fetches all rows from the database using associative keys (defined by the first column).

N.b.: if multiple rows have the same first column value, the last row with that value will override earlier rows.

array string array array $spec $data array() array fetchCol Fetches the first column of all rows as a sequential array. array string array array $spec $data array() array fetchValue Fetches the very first value (i.e., first column of the first row). array string array mixed $spec $data array() array fetchPairs Fetches an associative array of all rows as key-value pairs (first column is the key, second column is the value). array string array array $spec $data array() array fetchOne Fetches one row from the database. array string array array $spec $data array() array quote Safely quotes a value for an SQL statement.

If an array is passed as the value, the array values are quoted and then returned as a comma-separated string; this is useful for generating IN() lists.

mixed string $val quoteInto Quotes a value and places into a piece of text at a placeholder; the placeholder is a question-mark. string mixed mixed $text $data quoteMulti Quote multiple text-and-value pieces.

The placeholder is a question-mark; all placeholders will be replaced with the quoted value. For example ...

{{code: php $sql = Solar::factory('Solar_Sql');

$list = array(
     "WHERE date > ?"   => '2005-01-01',
     "  AND date < ?"   => '2005-02-01',
     "  AND type IN(?)" => array('a', 'b', 'c'),
);
$safe = $sql->quoteMulti($list);

// $safe = "WHERE date > '2005-01-02'
//          AND date < 2005-02-01
//          AND type IN('a','b','c')"

}}

array string string $list $sep null quoteName Quotes a single identifier name (table, table alias, table column, index, sequence). Ignores empty values.

If the name contains ' AS ', this method will separately quote the parts before and after the ' AS '.

If the name contains a space, this method will separately quote the parts before and after the space.

If the name contains a dot, this method will separately quote the parts before and after the dot.

string array string array $spec quoteNamesIn Quotes all fully-qualified identifier names ("table.col") in a string, typically an SQL snippet for a SELECT clause.

Does not quote identifier names that are string literals (i.e., inside single or double quotes).

Looks for a trailing ' AS alias' and quotes the alias as well.

string array string array $spec lastInsertId Get the last auto-incremented insert ID from the database. string string int $table null $col null insert Inserts a row of data into a table. string array int $table $data update Updates a table with specified data based on a WHERE clause. string array string array int $table $data $where delete Deletes rows from the table based on a WHERE clause. string string array int $table $where bind Binds an array of scalars as values into a prepared PDOStatment.

Array element values that are themselves arrays will not be bound correctly, because PDO expects scalar values only.
